thread.title: Rainbow bagels take over New York; is New Jersey next?
thread.title_full: Rainbow bagels take over New York; is New Jersey next?

author: Peter Genovese | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Rainbow bagels take over New York; is New Jersey next?
text:
Comments 
Forget that boring old salt bagel and your cinnamon raisin with cream cheese -- the rainbow bagel is about to take over the bagel world. 
So says a Business Insider report on Scott Rossillo, whose rainbow bagel is the biggest seller at The Bagel Store in Brooklyn. 
The crazily-colored creations taste like cereal, are slathered with Funfetti-style cream cheese and covered with sprinkles. The process is so complicated Rossillo can make just 100 rainbow bagels every five hours. 
Multi-colored bagels are nothing new, of course, but maybe not quite to this extent; does your favorite Jersey bagel store make them? 
Don't want your bagels to look like the work of some mad scientist baker? Looking for great bagels on this side of the river? Check out the Munchmobile search for N.J.'s best bagels last month.
